questionListItems.title: I may have accidentally deleted my notification email. Can I check if I had successfully balloted for the event?

answer.body: It is the responsibility of the applicant to check for the notification email during the notification period, and to check their email trash bin if they think they might have accidentally deleted their email.

questionListItems.title: I am interested in volunteering for NDP, how do I go about it?

answer.body:
Through the #GiveAsOneSG campaign, we are calling on Singaporeans to commit their time and effort towards a cause that appeals to them.
Through the SG Cares app, you will be able to choose from a wide range of volunteering opportunities.
Some examples include spending time with our seniors, befriending our children and youth, or delivering food packages.

Besides volunteering, you may also check out Goodhood.SG to connect with other Singaporeans, lend a helping hand and give away your pre-loved items. You can also join us at the Blood Donation Drives organised by the Singapore Red Cross to donate blood to save lives.
Follow us on Facebook, Instagram and TikTok (@NDPeeps) for more information. Once again, we thank you for your interest in NDP 2023.

questionListItems.title: How do I know if I will be getting the tickets?

answer.body: You will be notified via the personal email provided during the application process. The notification email will be sent from the address: ndp2023@hapz.com and will inform you of the number of tickets that you have successfully balloted for.

questionListItems.title: I did not get the tickets even though I applied for them. Can I appeal?

answer.body: Unfortunately, no appeals on the ticket ballot results are allowed. Other than NDP at the Padang, there are also a range of NDP-related activities that are open to the public. These include GetActive! Heartland Festivals on the 5 and 6 August 2023, where you can enjoy performances and activities. We invite you to join us there.

questionListItems.title: I need a high resolution image of the NDP 2023 logo and/or August Mascot, where can I find them?

answer.body: You can contact us via email at ndp2023@defence.gov.sg for assistance on getting the high resolution images of the NDP 2023 logo and August Mascot.

questionListItems.title: I am organising a National Day Observation celebration, can I use the NDP logo for cupcakes design without approval?

answer.body:
The NDP 2023 logo is limited to NDP 2023 participants, sponsors, and partners.
Usage of NDP 2023 logo without approval from the NDP2023 EXCO will result in copyright infringement.
Once again, we thank you for your interest in NDP 2023. Please email in to Ndp2023@defence.gov.sg for approval

questionListItems.title: I saw tickets to NDP 2023 sold online. Is it safe to purchase them?

answer.body: NDP tickets are strictly NOT FOR SALE and should not be purchased through unauthorised channels, as these pose a high risk of fraud or scams. Tickets obtained from such sources may be rendered void, and those holding such tickets may be denied entry to the venue. If you come across any unauthorised sale of tickets, please report it to the NDP 2023 committee or the authorities.

questionListItems.title: How do I get to the Padang?

answer.body: You can find directions to the Padang in the Admission Advisory provided here, or by scanning the QR code on the back of the physical ticket to access the advisory.

questionListItems.title: Will I be notified if I didn’t win?

answer.body: Due to the high volume of applications received, we are only able to notify successful applicants. Our focus is on informing the successful applicants to ensure a smooth and efficient ticket allocation process. We appreciate your understanding.

questionListItems.title: Where can I buy the tickets?

answer.body: NDP tickets are only allocated through balloting and are strictly NOT FOR SALE. Any attempts to sell the tickets will result in them being rendered void. Actions will be taken against offenders.

questionListItems.title: I’ve balloted for the tickets, what happens if I am unable to attend the parade?

answer.body: Please ensure you are able to attend the parade when balloting, you may pass the tickets to your loved ones to attend on your behalf.

questionListItems.title: What should I look out for in the email notifying me of a successful ballot?

answer.body:
Successful applicants should take note that the official notification emails will only be sent from the following email address: ndp2023@hapz.com.

Recipients of any notifications on NDP 2023 should beware of emails sent from other addresses as they could be scams or phishing attempts. You may notify the committee at ndp2023@defence.gov.sg for suspected fraud activities.

questionListItems.title: Where can I follow NDP on social media?

answer.body: Please follow us @NDPeeps on Facebook, YouTube, Instagram and Tiktok!

questionListItems.title: Where and when will the fireworks be set off in the Heartlands?

answer.body: On 9 August, fireworks will be set off in the heartlands, concurrent with that at The Padang. The five Heartland sites will feature fireworks displays in the evening. The fireworks displays are expected to happen between 8:15pm to 8:25pm concurrent with the fireworks medley at The Padang. The five sites will be open to the public for viewing of the fireworks, and entry will be allowed from 6.00pm onwards. For more information on the specific viewing spots, please refer to the NDP website.

questionListItems.title: Do I need tickets for the Heartland Festivals and how can I get them?

answer.body: Singaporeans/ Permanent Residents are eligible to apply for tickets to visit the Carnival sites. Application for tickets can be done via online application via the NDP website from 15 July onwards. Tickets will be distributed on a first-come-first-served basis.
